articles.title: Nepal Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli resigns amid escalating protests
articles.description: Nepal's Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday, September 9, 2025, following widespread anti-corruption protests that led to violence and the deaths of 19 demonstrators. Protesters stormed government buildings and set the parliament ablaze. The protests, fueled by anger over corruption and nepotism, escalated after a social media ban was lifted.

articles.title: Trump note to Epstein that he denies writing is released by Congress
articles.description: The House Oversight Committee released a trove of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, including a birthday card with a drawing allegedly sent by President Trump. Trump has denied any involvement with the card. The documents also include Epstein's will, contact book, and information on his bank accounts.

articles.title: Supreme Court lifts restrictions on LA immigration stops set after agents swept up US citizens
articles.description: The Supreme Court has blocked a federal judge's ruling that had restricted federal officers from conducting immigration stops in Los Angeles. This decision comes as ICE operations are reportedly increasing in Chicago.
